summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell case discussing discovery issues. It covers technical problems with evidence production, including metadata issues with files from Epstein's devices, difficulties delivering discovery materials to Maxwell in prison, and requests for additional information about evidence handling.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell; makes detailed requests about discovery metadata and file formats.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell; raises multiple discovery issues including problems with delivering materials to Maxwell at MDC.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York involved in discovery production for the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell; copied on discovery discussions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the case; mentioned in context of difficulties reviewing discovery materials while incarcerated at MDC.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case; mentioned as potential arbiter if MDC refuses to accept discovery materials from defense.

connections.description: Co-counsel representing Ghislaine Maxwell, working together on discovery issues.

events.title: Discovery Production Delivery
events.description: Prosecutors send additional discovery production to defense via USAfx and FedEx CD to MDC.

events.title: Discovery Issues Raised
events.description: Defense attorneys send detailed list of discovery problems to prosecutors including metadata issues and delivery problems to MDC.

events.title: November 2020 Discovery Production
events.description: Prosecutors produced images from CDs seized during 2019 searches of Epstein residences.

events.title: October 2020 Discovery Production
events.description: Prosecutors produced videos converted from VHS and cassette tapes by a vendor.

events.title: Searches of Epstein Residences
events.description: FBI conducted searches of Jeffrey Epstein's residences, seizing CDs containing images.

keyFacts: Over 109,000 emails were produced without attachments, with attachments appearing only as slip-sheets.
Over 110,000 electronic documents from Epstein's devices show metadata with 'date created' or 'date last modified' dates in July 2020 or later, raising questions about evidence handling.
Over 6,500 photographs were produced without CART numbers and with creation dates after July 2019, creating uncertainty about their origin and chain of custody.
The defense reported that Ghislaine Maxwell could not read some discovery files on prison computers and requested alternative delivery methods.
Prosecutors indicated that for carved or deleted files from Epstein's devices, no metadata was recovered and thus none is viewable.
